review: I'm a little disappointed so far. I've been using the Fire Stick for a couple of weeks and so far, I like my Roku 3 better. The Fire Stick seems to load more slowly and I could not get the mirroring from my phone to work and sending YouTube videos from my phone to my TV repeatedly failed until I just gave up. YouTube sends videos to my Roku 3 immediately and seamlessly. I'll try the Fire Stick again, but several attempts the other night just crashed.I do like the games and apps that are available, but I haven't found a great way to search for them yet. No more apps than Roku, but there are more free games, not that I'm a gamer, but nice when kids come over. Voice search worked well from my phone app.I'm glad I bought it because I needed it and I decided on this one because of the price and memory space, but I'm glad it is just for my second TV because I like the Roku 3 for primary use even though it was more expensive (worth the extra in my opinion).

review: This is pretty awesome!!! I love the fact that you can use it with a computer monitor with HDMI. I went back and forth a lot between buying this or google Chrom Cast. Decided on this since Amazon Prime Play isn't compatible with chrome and chrome doesn't come with a remote! Also it comes with extra cord extender between the stick and the tv/monitor, where with chrome you have to purchase if you HDMI isn't a side port but one that stick straight into the wall. Totally love this!! My only complaint is that you have to be careful with purchases, unless you change your setting in Fire TV its as easy as one click, it doesn't ask for verification. My first day I accidentally bought an upgrade to Amazon Prime since I was using a different account. Thankfully I was able to call and have amazon refund me without a problem.
